html.label: SInfo
html.b: Thank you for participating in this survey. All information collected in this survey will be kept completely confidential and anonymous.

radio.label: S0
radio.title:
We believe in research
We want to remind you the company sponsoring this relies on the results to make key business decisions. Therefore, it's very important that you provide considered and accurate responses.
You'll notice some simple questions unrelated to the survey topic, they're part of our quality controls, to ensure you're paying attention.
If a participant fails these questions, the survey may be treated as invalid. And you may not get full incentives.
Are you happy to co-operate with these quality controls and to answer this survey accurately?

survey.html:
Thank you for helping with our survey.
We would like to remind you that there are no right or wrong answers - it's your own thoughts and opinions that matter. Any comments you make will not be linked to you personally, but will be reported as a group. Please take your time in completing this questionnaire thoroughly. For most questions, you will only need to click in a tick box with your mouse. Other questions will require you to type in a response or a value.
Now, I would like to ask you about...

select.label: Q23
select.title:
Please take a moment to look over this description again and indicate all aspects that you do and do not like about it.
You may do so by clicking on the green Positive box and then on any phrases or wording that you LIKE (they will turn green), and clicking on the red Negative box and then on any phrases and wording you particularly DISLIKE (they will turn red). You may click on the area again to de-select it.
To be able to continue with the survey you need to highlight at least one positive or one negative aspect. When you have finished highlighting, click NEXT to continue the survey.

row.label: r1
row.b: The Only Tubeless Pump You Can Wear For Up to 5 Days

select.row: Tubeless insulin pumps are smaller and more discrete,
with no dangling tubes to get in your way.
But with a limited battery life
you've had to peel off the old pump and put on a new one every three days.
System X is the only one you can wear for up to five full days.
and latest advanced hybrid closed-loop technology you're looking for,
Small and discrete just 1.7" x 2.4" and only half an inch thick
holds 50% more insulin than other tubeless pumps
Advanced hybrid closed-loop accuracy automatically keeps you in range with its CGM and latest advanced hybrid closed loop system
Simple, smartphone control do it all right from your phone, using an intuitive touch-screen app

number.label: C5a
number.title: At what price point would you consider the fragrance to be priced so cheap that you would doubt its quality and not buy it?
number.comment:
Please enter a number
range(1 to 997).

number.label: C5b
number.title: At what price point would you consider the fragrance to be great value/a bargain and you would definitely buy it?
number.comment:
Please enter a number.
Note:ALLOW RESPONDENT TO TYPE IN AMOUNT, MUST BE HIGHER THAN PREVIOUS.
number.validate: if ((C5b.val) lt (C5a.val)) or ((C5b.val) == (C5a.val)): error("Your previously given value is ${C5a.val}, please give higher than ${C5a.val}")

number.label: C5c

number.validate: if ((C5c.val) lt (C5b.val)) or ((C5c.val) == (C5b.val)): error("Your previously given value is ${C5b.val}, please give higher than ${C5b.val}")

radio.title: Please select your level of agreement or disagreement for the following statements.
radio.comment: Please select one response for each statement.
radio.row: I struggle to breastfeed my baby
I feel like a failure as a mum feeding my baby with formula
I love the convenience and freedom that formula gives me as a mum
There are so many brands of formula on the market - it's hard to know what's best for my baby
I only buy organic formula for my baby
My baby has dietary requirements so I need to be very selective in which formula I buy
I'm not too fussed about the specific ingredients of the formula as long as my baby tolerates it
I do extensive research when it comes to which formula is best for my baby
I mainly rely on recommendations from friends / other mums when it comes to choosing formula
Advertising from formula brands has helped me choose a brand for my baby
I just stuck to the formula brand my baby was introduced to in the hospital
I'm happy to pay more for premium formula
I buy whatever formula is cheapest / on special

block.label: b4
block.builder:title: VideoCapture Element Block
block.html: You may be asked to provide a video answer (for an additional incentive of $5 if applicable) to one or more of the questions in this survey, if possible, please complete it on a device with a webcam or built-in camera. Remember that you do not have to participate immediately feel free to complete this survey at a better time, or when you're in a better location to record a video.

Video opt-in
We Analyticsify are interested in hearing what consumers think about (insert question topic) and would like to ask if you are open to sharing your comments via a video response.
We find that we are able to get richer feedback when participants speak aloud their thoughts, rather than typing them into a text box. The video you record will not be used beyond this study and will be stored anonymously and will not be shared in any public domain.
Communication
Your participation in this video section is voluntary. If you do respond your Video Response must:-
respond fully to the questionnaire
not violate any third party's intellectual property rights
not be unlawful, offensive, threatening, libellous, defamatory, obscene or otherwise objectionable. For example nudity or semi nudity is likely to be considered obscene.
not be recorded in an inappropriate setting such as for example a toilet.
contain at least 15 seconds of recorded speech
ensure your face is clearly visible
ensure there are no audio or visual issues
How will my video be used?
By recording and submitting a Video Response, you are agreeing to it being used for the purposes stated below. Your Video Response, or parts of it, may be used by Clients or Analyticsify and/or its appointed subcontractors for:
market research and consumer insight purposes
monitoring the quality of responses
processing data for the above purposes.
Storage & Retention
Personal Information that Analyticsify may collect from you is routinely de-identified and/or destroyed. However, until that occurs, you have the right to access any information we hold about you. You may also request at any time to have any information we hold about you de-identified or destroyed. Your personal information will be stored on servers located within Australia.
Privacy Policy
Our Privacy Policy is available here and contains further details regarding how you can access or correct any personal information we hold about you, how you can make a privacy related complaint, how that complaint will be dealt with and the extent to which your information may be disclosed to overseas recipients.

html.label: cm_B1_d
html.cond: not(gv.request.device.isSmartphone() or gv.request.device.isFeaturephone() or gv.request.device.isTablet()) and (MergeQsn.r6)

survey.html:
Over the next few screens we are going to show a brand and an attribute (e.g. quality or innovative, etc).
Press your "A" key if you Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Press your "L" key if you Don't Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Try and answer as quickly as you can. But, hey, if you don't know, don't worry.
This is for fun, it isn't a test.
Just to make sure you understand the task, we're going to do a quick practice run.
Click Next when you are ready to do the practice run.

Over the next few screens we are going to show a brand and an attribute (e.g. quality or innovative, etc).
Please tap on "thumbs up" icon if you Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Please tap on "thumbs down" key if you Don't Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Try and answer as quickly as you can. But, hey, if you don't know, don't worry.
This is for fun, it isn't a test.
Just to make sure you understand the task, we're going to do a quick practice run.
Click Next when you are ready to do the practice run.

html.label: cm_B1_1_d
html.cond: not(gv.request.device.isSmartphone() or gv.request.device.isFeaturephone() or gv.request.device.isTablet()) and (MergeQsn.r6)

survey.html:
Right, now for the real exercise.
As before, press your "A" key if you Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Press your "L" key if you Don't Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Try and answer as quickly as you can.
Click Next when you are ready to go.

Right, now for the real exercise.
As before, please tap on "thumbs up" icon if you Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Please tap on "thumbs down" key if you Don't Agree the attribute matches the brand.
Try and answer as quickly as you can.
Click Next when you are ready to go.

number.label: SEC1
number.ss:preText: Number of family members living in the same house
number.title:
How many family members live in your household?
REMARKS:
The total family member live together and share food in the same kitchen. Including children in any range of age, not including workers who work in the household (maid/chauffeur, etc) and guests.

radio.label: SEC2
radio.title:
Only for classification purposes, with this showcard, how much is your average household expenditure in a month? (Coming from purchases, own production and giving).
For food expenditures including:
Rice, corn, wheat, rice flour, cornflour, cassava,
sweet potato, potato, taro, sago,
Fish/shrimp/squid/mussels
fresh/salted/preserved, meat, eggs, milk,
vegetables, nuts, fruits,
Oil, beverage ingredients (sugar, tea, coffee, etc.),
seasonings, instant noodles, crackers, bread,
biscuits, porridge, meatballs,
soft drinks, ice syrup, mineral water, alcohol,
tobacco sticks, hand-rolled cigarettes, etc. For non-food expenditures including:
Lease, contract, estimates of the rent per month,
Electricity bills, telephone, gas, kerosene,
Account home phone, toll-HP, public telephones,
kiosks,
Bath soap/shampoo, cosmetics, hair care/face,
tissue,
Cost of Education, transportation, gasoline, diesel
fuel, lubricating oils,
Levies/charges, insurance paid per month

radio.label: SEC3
radio.title: What kind of fuel most commonly used in the household for daily cooking needs?

block.exec:
sec3_score= 0
if SEC3.r1: sec3_score= 5
elif SEC3.r2: sec3_score= 4
elif SEC3.r3: sec3_score= 2
elif SEC3.r4: sec3_score= 4
elif SEC3.r5: sec3_score= 2
elif SEC3.r6: sec3_score= 1
elif SEC3.r7: sec3_score= 1
elif SEC3.r8: sec3_score= 1
elif SEC3.r9: sec3_score= 1
elif (SEC3.r10 and SEC2.inrange(0,14)) : sec3_score= 2
elif (SEC3.r10 and SEC2.inrange(15,21)) : sec3_score= 3
elif (SEC3.r10 and SEC2.inrange(22,29)) : sec3_score= 4

radio.label: SEC4
radio.title: What kind of sources of drinking water are most commonly used in the household?

block.exec:
sec4_score= 0
if SEC4.r1: sec4_score= 4
elif SEC4.r2: sec4_score= 3
elif SEC4.r3: sec4_score= 3
elif SEC4.r4: sec4_score= 2
elif SEC4.r5: sec4_score= 2
elif SEC4.r6: sec4_score= 1
elif SEC4.r7: sec4_score= 1
elif SEC4.r8: sec4_score= 0
elif SEC4.r9: sec4_score= 0
elif SEC4.r10: sec4_score= 0
elif SEC4.r11: sec4_score= 0
elif SEC4.r12: sec4_score= 0

scores.r1.val= sec2_score
scores.r2.val= sec3_score
scores.r3.val= sec4_score
scores.r4.val= (sec2_score + sec3_score + sec4_score)

number.label: scores
number.title: CALCULATION-ALL SCORE

block.label: autopunch_with_numbertype

radio.label: X3
radio.title: Do you have children either living in or outside your household?

radio.label: X4
radio.title: Which of the following best describes the household you live in?
radio.comment: Please select the one answer that most applies.
radio.row: Live in a shared adult household

block.exec: if X4.r1 or X4.r2 or X4.r3 or X4.r4: X50.val = "0"

number.label: X50
number.title: How many children currently live in your household?

radio.label: S16
radio.title: Thinking about where you would ideally like to buy, how appealing are the following areas?
radio.comment: Please select one in each row.

checkbox.label: A71
checkbox.title: Once the image is fully loaded, click on the product you think stands out the most.

radio.label: A72
radio.title: Once the image is fully loaded, click on the product you think stands out the most.

number.label: difftime
number.title: difftime

block.label: block79
block.html:
Now, lets move on to the main topic of this survey.
Gabor Granger could be a good way of removing the rotation bias that the client is concerned about. If a respondent is unwilling to pay the lowest price, or willing to pay the highest price, then there is no need for rotation anyway. There are more ways you can enhance this approach, but then it starts bordering on a PSM methodology which were not keen on.
block.exec: arr1=[0,1,2,3] random.shuffle(arr1) Price.val = arr1[0]

radio.label: Price
radio.title: punch 1st price
radio.comment: This is a hide question, will be auto hide during the FW

number.label: Auto_price
number.title: Hidenquestion

radio.label: B4a_1
radio.title: How likely would you be to purchase this product if it cost $[pipe:Price], and was available from where you usually shop?

radio.label: B4b_1
radio.cond: ((B4a_1.r1 or B4a_1.r2 or B4a_1.r3) and (Price.r2 or Price.r3 or Price.r4) or (B4a_1.r4 or B4a_1.r5) and (Price.r1 or Price.r2 or Price.r3)) and p.numB4b_1 ge 10 and p.numB4b_1 le 40
radio.title: If this gaming service you have just seen was available at a cost of $${p.numB4b_1} per month, how likely would you be to purchase it for yourself or your household?

radio.label: B4c_1
radio.cond: (B4b_1.inrange(0,2) and (B4a_1.inrange(0,2)) and p.numB4c_1 ge 10 and p.numB4c_1 le 40) or (B4b_1.inrange(3,4) and (B4a_1.inrange(3,4)) and p.numB4c_1 ge 10 and p.numB4c_1 le 40)
radio.title: If this gaming service you have just seen was available at a cost of $${p.numB4c_1} per month, how likely would you be to purchase it for yourself or your household?

radio.label: B4d_1
radio.cond: ((B4c_1.r5 or B4c_1.r4) and (Price.r1) or (B4c_1.r1 or B4c_1.r2 or B4c_1.r3) and (Price.r4)) and p.numB4d_1 ge 10 and p.numB4d_1 le 40
radio.title: If this gaming service you have just seen was available at a cost of $${p.numB4d_1} per month, how likely would you be to purchase it for yourself or your household?

number.label: MAXPRICE_1
number.title: Record the max price

block.exec: if MAXPRICE_1.ival==0: B4e_1.val=4 if MAXPRICE_1.ival==10: B4e_1.val=3 if MAXPRICE_1.ival==20: B4e_1.val=2 if MAXPRICE_1.ival==30: B4e_1.val=1 if MAXPRICE_1.ival==40: B4e_1.val=0

radio.label: B4e_1
radio.title: Record MAX PRICE
radio.comment: This is a hide question, will be auto hide during the FW

number.label: Van_price1
number.title: At what price would you consider the product to be so expensive that you would not consider buying it? (Too Expensive)

number.label: Van_price2
number.title: At what price would you consider the product starting to get expensive, so that it is not out of the question, but you would have to give some thought to buying it? (Expensive/High Side)
number.validate: if (Van_price2.val) gt (Van_price1.val): error("previously you said ${Van_price1.val} is too expensive please enter less than ${Van_price1.val}")

number.label: Van_Price3
number.title: At what price would you consider the product to be a bargain - a great buy for the money? (Cheap/Good Value)
number.validate: if (Van_Price3.val) gt (Van_price2.val): error("previously you said ${Van_price2.val} is expensive please enter less than ${Van_price2.val}")

number.label: Van_price4
number.title: At what price would you consider the product to be priced so low that you would feel the quality couldn't be very good? (Too Cheap)
number.validate: if (Van_price4.val) gt (Van_Price3.val): error("previously you said ${Van_Price3.val} is cheap please enter less than ${Van_Price3.val}")

number.label: Van_priceall
number.title: At what price would you consider the product to be priced ....

checkbox.label: F_Flash
checkbox.title: Please review the image. After 1.5 seconds, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

block.label: CH_block1
block.builder:title: Discrete choice_model for metrix
block.exec:
def setupDCMFile(fname, fileDelimiter="\t"): f = open("%s/%s" % (gv.survey.path, fname)) dcmObj = [ line.strip("\r\n").split(fileDelimiter) for line in f.readlines() ]
d = {} dcm_concepts = []
for i,row in enumerate(dcmObj): if i: d["v%s_t%s_c%s" % (row[0],row[1],row[2])] = row[3:] if row[2] not in dcm_concepts: dcm_concepts.append(row[2])
concepts = [ int(x) for x in dcm_concepts ] concepts.sort() d["concepts"] = dcm_concepts
return d
#set persistent items, format: p.concept#_att# def setupDCMItems(d, vt, t1, prefix="1"): print "***** STAFF ONLY *****" print "***** DCM Matrix *****" print "Version_Task: %s" % vt print(vt) for concept in d.get("concepts"): attributes = d[ "%s_c%s" % (vt,concept) ] print "Concept %s: %s" % (concept,attributes)
for i,attr in enumerate(attributes): print(attributes[i]) print "adasdasd" eval("progAttr_"+t1+".r"+concept+".c"+str(i+1)).val=attributes[i]
Q24_dcm = setupDCMFile("design1.dat")

number.label: Q24_Version
number.title: Q24 - DCM Version

block.exec: p.startTime = timeSpent()

block.label: Q24_dcm_block
block.exec: setupDCMItems( Q24_dcm, "v%s_t%s" % (Q24_Version.val,"[loopvar: task]"),"[loopvar: task]", "Q24") p.DCMcount = "%d" % (Q24_dcm_loop_expanded.order.index([loopvar: task]-1) + 1)

text.label: progAttr_[loopvar: task]
text.title: Programming to punch attributes for rows

block.exec:
hidAttribute1_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept1_hidAttribute4_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept2_hidAttribute4_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept3_hidAttribute4_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept4_hidAttribute4_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept5_hidAttribute4_[loopvar: task].val=1
concept1_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept2_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept3_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept4_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept5_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task].val=1
concept1_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept2_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept3_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept4_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept5_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task].val=1
concept1_hidAttribute7_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept2_hidAttribute7_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept3_hidAttribute7_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept4_hidAttribute7_[loopvar: task].val=1 concept5_hidAttribute7_[loopvar: task].val=1
for itr1 in range(1,4): for itr in range(1,7): val1=eval("progAttr_[loopvar: task].r"+str(itr)+".c"+str(itr1)).val val2=eval("concept"+str(itr)+"_hidAttribute"+str(itr1)+"_[loopvar: task].r"+str(val1)).index print(val1,val2) eval("concept"+str(itr)+"_hidAttribute"+str(itr1)+"_[loopvar: task]").val=val2
concept1_hidAttribute3_[loopvar: task].val=int(progAttr_[loopvar: task].r1.c2.val) concept2_hidAttribute3_[loopvar: task].val=int(progAttr_[loopvar: task].r2.c2.val)

radio.label: concept1_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row: See who is at your door and be alerted to deliveries wherever you are, and open your garage remotely for safe delivery. Check the camera to make sure your goods and home are secure.

radio.label: concept2_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row: Feel secure knowing you can monitor you home at all times, with the added comfort of automatic exterior lights to give you clear vision at night and to be alerted when sensors go off.

radio.label: concept3_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row: See who is at your door and let them into your home remotely. Set the scene with music while you finish getting ready.

radio.label: concept4_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row: No more worrying about keys. See who is at your door (e.g. kids, cleaner, pet sitter) and let them in remotely. Keep an eye on them and your home once inside.

radio.label: concept5_hidAttribute5_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row: No more worrying about keys if you are running late and wont be home to let in the kids/pet sitter/cleaner. See when they are at your door and let them in remotely. The door can be deadlocked giving you peace of mind that they are safe inside.

radio.label: concept3_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row:
Product integration:
Doorbell, Gainsborough smart doorlock, Sonos speakers

radio.label: concept4_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row:
Product integration:
Doorbell, Camera, Gainsborough smart doorlock

radio.label: concept5_hidAttribute6_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed
radio.row:
Product integration:
Doorbell, Gainsborough smart doorlock

row.label: r1
row.i: The door lock and Sonos hardware is not included in the bundle pricing

row.label: r1
row.i: The door lock hardware is not included in the bundle pricing

row.label: r1
row.i: The door lock hardware is not included in the bundle pricing

html.label: dcm_[loopvar: task]
html.span:
Version:[pipe: Q24_Version] Task:[loopvar: task]
Scenario [loopvar: task] of 12

radio.label: BEFOREFINAL
radio.title: Based on the results of this survey, we might be interested in conducting further research. Would you be interested in participating and us contacting you?
radio.row: Yes, I am happy to be contacted via email

text.label: Opinion_yes
text.title: I would like to be contacted for a follow up interview

div.span: Thank you for your valued opinion!

select.label: Finalx1
select.title: What was your overall experience of the survey?
select.comment: Drag the slider to a point on the scale.

textarea.label: Finalx3
textarea.title: Were really keen to improve our surveys, please let us know how we could have improved this survey for you?
textarea.comment: Any feedback you give will be most helpful!

div.span: Thats the end of the Survey!
